intro: Angylocalyx zenkeri var. gossweileri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are usually velvety and dark green, while its stems are compact and often produce offsets. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is widely cultivated as a houseplant.
